replies.body: That new drop mechanic is unneeded and honestly terrible. It's going to get really frustrating if two components combine into an item I simply don't need
Exactly what i thought, id rather have 2 seperate items  than  a completed item, which is why I partly hate dragon+ rounds.

Totally agree.  In many cases during dragon rounds I get a Yuumi or Youmuu's Ghostblade which does not match my team comp and the other team gets a Rageblade or Red Buff.  I know it is random, but something like that should not determine the game.

That said, Yuumi still grants the sorc bonus of double mana on attack and +40 ap so its pretty good no matter what especially on something like a yasuo, akali, or poppy since their abilities are so impactful
Don't listen to crossed swords.  Sorcs get an innate bonus with or without multiple sorcs.  That's why it's INNATE.

The only positive I can see coming from this change is that people might pivot to different comps early if they get a full strong item. This would diversify the comps being built in a game. I find it too common that everyone is building the same 3 comps and the champ pool is weighted unevenly.  If I got a random blademaster (recurve+spach) or comp specific item I might pivot to make that comp because it would be easier. Just a thought.

But from how it's worded, you'd already be somewhat likely to do that. It's kinda vague, but how I see it is that if you get two items from a minion round: it will randomly drop it combined instead of broken apart. So if you get a Giant's Belt and a Tear but had a bf sword and nlr on the bench... Even though you probably want the components so you could make morello and shojin or zekes and ludens, it could randomly just give you redemption. It's added rng that can ONLY be negative. Because if you wanted to combine the items, you will.

Now if it's just a rare chance to drop a combined item period, not "auto combined the items you got" it'd be kinda nice. Too rng heavy (this dude just got an rfc and another recurve off of wolves!? Gg rng,) but kinda nice.

It would force certain. Items to be built that aren't normally built (because they aren't one of the few OP items).  This is not a guaranteed negative.  It forces diversification of stratagy to accommodate uncommon items

No, the combination is only negative. What I mean by that is if you were to combine the item, you'd do it. It takes away the decision to combine it or not. That's negative, no matter if you think items are a problem or not. (item diversity is actually really good right now. It's just that some items are a lot worse than others. It's not that some are better.)

Also keep in mind, items are built to counter certain comps and empower your own. If you're playing gunslingers and are against a healing heavy comp, you neeeeeeeed Red Buff or you lose. So what if you have a chain vest on your bench but it drops a completed redemption? Even though you needed that giants belt and could have made use of the tear later on, you LOSE now because the game decided to combine the items for you. Now say it it drops that Red Buff instead. What do you gain from it? You were going to build it anyways. There is no situation where the item dropping pre-made actually is positive. It's only negative.

I don't like the full item drops off PVE rounds. If you need items because you didn't get any drops earlier, it feels horrible to get a random ass Redemption or Blademaster buff etc. when you need to build something useful for your comp.
i feel the same way, i dont like this idea at all
Well the game is all about adaptation so as bad as this can be the game is still testing how well you adapt to the present situation.
How does being given random full items make you have to adapt. Components let you make decisions and help you adapt. Being given a full item gives you no decisions on that front.

We REALLY need a **Tab menu that shows each player's composition and the champions they have on their bench**, similar to regular LoL's Tab menu. 

Currently, to get a sense of what we should build, **we have to go through every player one by one and memorize, for each champion (!), who has how many of them**, which is incredibly tedious. Strength of memory is NOT one of the core pillars of TFT and so having to check players one by one, as we currently have to, is a detriment to playing the game around its core pillars.

**Visually, I would picture it similar to how the end-game screen looks**, with the champion icon with stars above them all in a row, for each player. The only thing I would add is having a 2nd row that represents what you have on your bench. Having an icon we could hover that shows you which Trait bonuses that player has would also be very nice, but I could see counterarguments to having that as a feature.
But u can scroll to the other player’s screens to see what they have I’m pretty sure that’s the equivalent of the tab screen, and I’m pretty sure it’s intentional to make the game harder

It's not really harder in a skillful way
It's just harder in a pain in the ass way

I don't mean to hijack this thread. The TAB menu is a great idea(by the OP.) I would like to see this feature for the added benefit of being able to mute individual players w/o having to mute all chat (same as SR tab menu.)  Having one obnoxious player spamming toxic garbage can really ruin the flow of an otherwise great new game.

Found myself thinking this today.  In the post-game lobby, we're able to see what champions people had and what rank they were at - it shouldn't be difficult to be able to replicate this exact information into a screen when we press and hold tab, no?  I don't think there'd be a decent way to show anything more (positioning, items) apart from perhaps income level (0-5) and win/lose streak.  

But holy heck, consolidation of a lot of information would streamline a lot of play at all tiers, not to mention make the game easier to follow and teach.

To reiterate; please create a window when we hold tab to show the **champions** of each player, and perhaps their **income level and win/lose streak** as well.
yo the new drop mechanic is whack, its feels like im losing control over what items i make.

That's literally what it is. Instead of dropping a tear and a rod, you're forced a redemption... Yaaaay!

Even if the items were all so balanced that no item was "bad", there is already forced adaptation in the RNG of item drops (and champ pools) as it is, adding more on top of that is just silly.

The autocombine is a step on the wrong direction imo. It takes power and decision making away from the player in one of the most meaningful tactical decisions in the game (item combination) considering items can win or lose you the game... The existing Item drop RNG is enough.
It's not an autocombine, it just adds a chance for completed items to drop from minions.

That's not the case. It specifically says it'll drop a completed item instead of 2 separate pieces.

That means if you were going to get, say.. A Recurve Bow and a Giant's Belt in the same round, there's a chance you will instead get a Titanic Hydra.

It automatically combines the 2 items you would have gotten, rather than giving you the 2 items separately.

By saying auto combine you implying that it is guaranteed that they will combine, which is not what they said. They said that sometimes instead of getting the components to make the item they will just drop the item. It doesn't say they will just automatically combine all items to make it so you can't get the components no matter what. That would essentially make it impossible to build items.

So instead of "automatically does something bad" it should be read "has a chance to automatically do something bad"...

Either way, still bad.
Is nobody gonna say anything about FIXING AFK CHAMPIONS in game??

New Drop Mechanic
In rare instances it's now possible to drop a full completed item instead of the two components separately.

This seems worded weirdly. Does this mean that if, for example, Murk Wolves dropped Spatula/Recurve, it's possible that instead of dropping both, the game rolls another roll on top of that and decides to only drop the completed BotRK? Or does it mean that in the hypothetical Spat/RB situation you could get Spat/BotRK, or BotRK/RB?

Thank you for any clarification.
I think in cases when one minion would drop two or more items, the system will auto combine as many as possible before boxing.
I think it works like in the carousel rounds, where you can sometimes get a full item on a champion, there will just be a possible chance of getting a random full item from PvE rounds.

Players: "Not getting any items when others do feels really bad, please make everyone get the same number of items"

Riot: "We're now going to randomly drop fully completed items for even less choice"

Morellonomicon
Burn Damage Duration: 5 seconds ⇒ 10 seconds
Red Buff
Burn Damage Duration: 5 seconds ⇒ 10 seconds

Cool patch, but this is pretty strange to me. Can anyone explain this? These are two of the strongest and most frequently built items in the game already, and they are straight up buffed to last TWICE as long? 200%?

The way I'm thinking it works is not the way you think. If I recall, let's take Red Buff for example. It does, what 13% max hp over a set interval, previously 5 seconds. The nerf now is that it takes twice as long to deal the percent damage. In other words, it will generally take twice as long to do the total damage. So instead of doing about 2.6% max hp per second for 5 seconds, it does 1.3% max hp per second for 10 seconds.

I presume this is a good nerf.
More of a power adjustment than a nerf. Slower burn, but they'll block healing for a long ass time.

Yeah, it really puts them as an anti-heal item rather than a damage item, which is what I think they should be. Their damage should still be decent, and it is more punishing to use them on single target units.

Can someone explain to me why we can't move items off of champions or move them to other champions once they've been placed? I feel like we should be able to do that, but there might be a reason why that I'm just missing...

1 reason: you could switch items as a unit was dying.
Another: forcing a player to sell the champ to get the items makes for more strategy, as you can't simply move items around willy nilly. So you have to decide if it is worth building that item now, saving it for a different champ, or saving the components for a different item.
